articles.author: Sarah Eckinger
articles.title: New Year’s Eve 2020: Pictures From Around the World
articles.description: Confetti is already flying as the new year makes its way across the globe.
articles.content:
From Australia to New York City, people are gathering to ring in the new year with fireworksand musical celebrations.
Heres a collection of images, updating as the clock strikes midnight around the world.

articles.author: Sophia June
articles.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
articles.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
articles.content:
$15.25 MILLION
308 East 109th Street (between First and Second Avenues)
Manhattan
This eight-story, 24,655-square-foot building in East Harlem contains 20 apartments and one commercial ground-floor unit. There are 13 one-bedrooms and seven three-bedrooms, … [+346 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Angola Freezes Assets of Ex-President’s Billionaire Daughter
articles.description: Isabel dos Santos, called Africa’s richest woman, is one of three people accused of causing the state losses of more than $1 billion.
articles.content: The state through its companies Sodiam (a diamond marketing firm) and Sonangol transferred enormous quantities of foreign currency to companies abroad whose beneficiaries are the defendants, without receiving the agreed return, the court said. The defendants … [+1280 chars]

articles.title: 79 of Our Favorite Facts of 2019
articles.description: Each day, our editors collect the most interesting, striking or delightful facts to appear in that day’s stories throughout the paper. Here are 79 of our very favorites.
articles.content:

articles.author: Charles V. Bagli
articles.title: Robert Durst, Subject of ‘The Jinx,’ Admits Writing Key Note in Murder Case
articles.description: Mr. Durst, who was profiled in the HBO series, had long denied mailing a note alerting the police to a dead body. Last week, his lawyers acknowledged that he did.
articles.content: The police in Los Angeles found Ms. Bermans body in 2000 after neighbors notified them that her back door was ajar and her terriers were running free. There was no sign of forced entry. Nothing had been taken, and no fingerprints or DNA were found from the ki… [+1829 chars]

articles.author: Jennifer Szalai
articles.title: ‘Uncanny Valley’ Charts a Tech Pilgrim’s Progress - The New York Times
articles.description: In this extraordinary memoir, Anna Wiener writes about joining the start-up industry and her eventual disillusionment with it.
articles.content: The language she was supposed to learn in her new milieu suggested that something was amiss. Wiener registered the unselfconscious deployment of hideous portmanteaus like designpreneurs and blitzscaling. The lexicon included an inordinate number of athletic a… [+2005 chars]

articles.title: The Best Things We Bought in 2019
articles.description: From a killer fly swatter to a family-worthy cargo bike, these are the things we bought this year that made our lives easier and a lot more fun.
articles.content:
YouCopia Storemore Adjustable Bakeware Rack ($20 at the time of publication)

articles.author: Shane Goldmacher
articles.title: Elizabeth Warren’s New Year’s Message: ‘We Come Together to Imagine’
articles.description: Ms. Warren delivered a major speech exactly a year after she entered the presidential race, reiterating her case against corruption but also seeking a more uplifting tone heading into 2020.
articles.content:
She cast 2020 as our chance to rewrite the rules of power in our country.
The billionaires, the corporate executives and their favorite presidential candidates have one clear goal: to convince you that everything you imagine is impossible, she said, sharpeni… [+1918 chars]

articles.author: Ben Dooley
articles.title: Carlos Ghosn’s Escape Astounds a Japan Struggling for Answers
articles.description: The prominent former auto executive eluded authorities and the media to flee while awaiting trial, setting off a flurry of speculation.
articles.content: Mr. Ghosns bail conditions barred him from using a phone, and he spent most of his days in his lawyers office, the only place he was allowed to use the internet. For months, he had been commuting from his home in an elegant neighborhood in central Tokyo to me… [+1671 chars]

articles.author: Jessica Olien
articles.title: Brooklyn’s Great American Diner
articles.description: Tom’s Restaurant, a beloved breakfast spot in Prospect Heights, is one of those places that feel welcoming to all who enter.
articles.content:
Culinary Arts Toms Restaurant, a beloved breakfast spot in Prospect Heights, is one of those places that feel welcoming to all who enter.
  • Dec. 31, 2019, 12:59 p.m. ET

articles.author: Jacey Fortin
articles.title: West Virginia Will Fire Corrections Cadets for Doing Nazi Salute
articles.description: The state’s governor released the results of an investigation into a photo and said he had approved the termination of the roughly 30 correctional trainees who appeared in it.
articles.content:
The report said that multiple students and instructors were aware that the gesture was inappropriate, but the investigation did not reveal any overt motivation or intent that this was a discriminatory act towards any racial, religious, or ethnic group.
The p… [+1911 chars]

articles.author: Motoko Rich
articles.title: Japan Loves Robots, but Getting Them to Do Human Work Isn’t Easy
articles.description: With a declining population and workers in short supply, Japan has fully embraced robots. But getting them to work to “the standard of humans” is often a challenge.
articles.content:
During a trial of self-driving buses in Oita City, also in southern Japan, one bus crashed into a curb, and officials realized that autonomous vehicles were not quite ready to cope with situations like traffic jams, jaywalkers or cars running red lights.
For… [+855 chars]

articles.author: Douglas Martin
articles.title: Gertrude Himmelfarb, Conservative Historian of Ideas, Dies at 97
articles.description: Her arguments that a little more virtuousness trumps any number of government social programs made her a hero to some and a bête noire to others.
articles.content: Ms. Himmelfarb was a member of an accomplished intellectual clan that sprung from working-class roots. Her brother, Milton Himmelfarb, who died in 2006, was an essayist known for his observations on Jewish affairs. Mr. Kristol, through his writing and editing… [+1560 chars]

articles.author: Florence Fabricant
articles.title: A Devotee of Basque Food Brings It to Two Bridges
articles.description: A revived Calle Ocho on the Upper West Side, a second branch of Norikoh, and more restaurant news.
articles.content: At 21, Ryan Bartlow took off for Spain, most specifically for San Sebastián in the Basque region. The chef worked at some good restaurants in his hometown, Chicago, after culinary school, and then got himself a two-year stint at Akelarre, a restaurant with th… [+3466 chars]

articles.title: Merkel’s New Year’s Speech Calls for Action on Climate and Tolerance
articles.description: The German chancellor, in her 15th such address, expressed optimism about the coming decade despite large challenges ahead.
articles.content: I, as a 65-year-old, will not personally experience all of the consequences that climate change will bring if politicians do not act, Ms. Merkel said in her roughly five-minute speech, adding that coming generations would live with the consequences of what we… [+789 chars]

articles.title: Why Abolishing Bail for Some Crimes Has Law Enforcement on Edge
articles.description: Democrats are hailing the new law, saying New York’s old bail system punished the poor. Critics say it will put criminals back on the streets.

articles.author: Laura M. Holson
articles.title: Throw a Dish. Don’t Eat Lobster. What Are Your New Year’s Superstitions?
articles.description: Across the world, there are many ways to ensure good luck: a kiss at midnight. A bowl of black-eyed peas, rice and pork. And, of course, swinging a flaming ball of fire to ward off evil.

articles.author: Pete Wells
articles.title: At the Four Horsemen, the Food Catches Up to the Wine
articles.description: The natural-wine bar co-owned by the musician James Murphy was always an interesting place to drink. Now the kitchen is among Brooklyn’s best.
articles.content: Vinegar slashes its way through fat and creamy Maine mussels, an unexpectedly alluring cold antipasto. Red algae, more appetizingly known as dulse, is smoked and crumbled over the tuna tonnato, a long-running favorite on the menu, made by spreading the creamy… [+1005 chars]

articles.title: The Meat-Lover’s Guide to Eating Less Meat
articles.description: Reducing your meat and dairy intake can help mitigate climate change. Melissa Clark has ideas for how to do it deliciously.
articles.content:

articles.author: The New York Times News Service Syndicate
articles.title: Only three NFL head coaches are black. “It’s embarrassing.”
articles.description: The summit “was birthed out of looking at the last few hiring cycles, and the appetite for offensive coaches,” said Troy Vincent, the NFL’s executive vice president of football operations. “When you look at the demographics, it’s embarrassing.”
articles.content:
By Ken Belson, The New York Times
